name: Monika Ludwig
content:
Monika Ludwig (born 1966 in Cologne)[1] is an Austrian mathematician, University Professor of Convex and Discrete Geometry at the Vienna University of Technology.[2]
 Ludwig earned a Dipl.-Ing. degree from the Vienna University of Technology in 1990, and a doctorate in 1994 under the supervision of Peter M. Gruber.[2][3] She remained at the same university as an assistant and associate professor from 1994 until 2007, when she moved to the Polytechnic Institute of New York University. She returned to the Vienna University of Technology as a full professor in 2010.[2]
 Ludwig won the Edmund and Rosa Hlawka Prize of the Austrian Academy of Sciences, given to an outstanding Austrian researcher in geometry of numbers or numerical analysis under the age of 30, in 1998.[4] She won the Prize of the Austrian Mathematical Society in 2004.[5]
 She became a corresponding member of the Austrian Academy of Sciences in 2011,[6] and a fellow of the American Mathematical Society in 2012.[7] She became a full member of the Austrian Academy of Sciences in 2013.

Academic career[edit]
Ludwig earned a Dipl.-Ing. degree from the Vienna University of Technology in 1990, and a doctorate in 1994 under the supervision of Peter M. Gruber.[2][3] She remained at the same university as an assistant and associate professor from 1994 until 2007, when she moved to the Polytechnic Institute of New York University. She returned to the Vienna University of Technology as a full professor in 2010.[2]

Awards and honors[edit]
Ludwig won the Edmund and Rosa Hlawka Prize of the Austrian Academy of Sciences, given to an outstanding Austrian researcher in geometry of numbers or numerical analysis under the age of 30, in 1998.[4] She won the Prize of the Austrian Mathematical Society in 2004.[5]
She became a corresponding member of the Austrian Academy of Sciences in 2011,[6] and a fellow of the American Mathematical Society in 2012.[7] She became a full member of the Austrian Academy of Sciences in 2013.

Notable publications[edit]
Monika Ludwig and Matthias Reitzner. A characterization of affine surface area. Adv. Math. 147 (1999), no. 1, 138–172.
Monika Ludwig. Projection bodies and valuations. Adv. Math. 172 (2002), no. 2, 158–168.
Monika Ludwig. Ellipsoids and matrix-valued valuations. Duke Math. J. 119 (2003), no. 1, 159–188.
Monika Ludwig. Minkowski valuations. Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 357 (2005), no. 10, 4191–4213.
Christoph Haberl and Monika Ludwig. A characterization of Lp intersection bodies. Int. Math. Res. Not. 2006, Art. ID 10548, 29 pp.
Monika Ludwig. Intersection bodies and valuations. Amer. J. Math. 128 (2006), no. 6, 1409–1428.
Monika Ludwig. General affine surface areas. Adv. Math. 224 (2010), no. 6, 2346–2360.
Monika Ludwig and Matthias Reitzner. A classification of SL(n) invariant valuations. Ann. of Math. (2) 172 (2010), no. 2, 1219–1267.
